p: Japanese encephalitis virus (JEV) is a member of the genus Flavivirus in the family Flaviviridae, containing a single-stranded, positive-sense RNA genome of approximately 11â€‰kb in length, which encodes three structural proteins, including the capsid (C), membrane (prM and M), and envelope (E), and seven nonstructural proteins (NS1, NS2A, NS2B, NS3, NS4A, NS4B, and NS5) ( 1).
